document.title: Business & Administrative Services, Logistics & Supply Chain Management, Finance and Marketing Career Field Pathways Management Principles

CCDB9C5EB7694E1FB3F9D6049326EE84.description:
Manage and maintain business records (e.g., accounting information, routing orders,
tracking shipments, expense reports, healthcare data, customer data, budget data,
quality data, human resources data).

E41A6DC15CEA48B89C3533CC3DBDABEA.description:
Assess information needs, identify and evaluate information quality and apply
information to accomplish a task.

549FD5A4C1BB411D9C7353FFA74F9D7F.description: Information Management: Identify, select and evaluate information management policies, processes and strategies.

3C25E5FED8C04D41B42066737EDE41DD.description:
Data and Process Management: Learners apply principles of business process management to collect, analyze and distribute
data and maintain business knowledge and information systems.

F29E277F235B4874A6D4124324112B37.description:
Explain the role and function of quality management (benchmarking, continuous
improvement, and Six Sigma, Lean) and identify quality controls (checklist, Pareto
charts, histograms).

07BBE66E27BC4CAFBEF3054B980B4FC5.description:
Define quality and identify quality control measures and techniques (e.g., Lean, Six
Sigma, ISO 9000, Malcolm Baldridge, DMAIC [Define, Measure, Analyze, Improve
and Control]).

13528D96EB6A4898A8E3CA0B9879BFB7.description: Quality Management: Identify, administer and evaluate quality control policies, processes and strategies.

B009A8F07DA7490C842C60463133553F.description: Operations Management: Learners identify and apply policies, processes and strategies for business operations.

1605CD34763F45E2A49044E2DC3E0103.description:
Explain how a diverse, equitable and inclusive work environment impacts business
objectives.

F187358D438E4A1187208F9584FB0A13.description: Research strategies for creating diverse, equitable and inclusive work environments.

A3F6835A114644EC94407E62E3F99B12.description:
Describe the role and function of coaching and mentoring and its impact on
employee performance.

9CDD0AC98FFD43E289B4618AC9EB6AF2.description: Implement employee recognition and rewards programs.

F0A2B0639F734492ADE1B5709D082C0D.description: Engagement and Retention: Identify, select and evaluate employee engagement and retention strategies.

D8A5B921474847C1BFDAB14D9413400C.description: Explain the concepts of pay equity, pay fairness and equal pay.

1E21E5717E52436599AC2A1D833095F7.description:
Explain the differences in compensation associated with employment classifications
(full time, part time, temporary/seasonal, contract, independent contractor, on-call,
volunteer, exempt, nonexempt).

6E65572F985D4E3B987AA47A06F86634.description: Compensation and Benefits: Identify, administer and evaluate compensation and benefits plans.

B693A343248B48ECBC94EB0EC59F32BD.description:
Evaluate the use of alternative staffing methods to meet business goals (e.g.,
outsourcing, telecommuting, shared responsibilities, flexible work schedules, virtual
teams, contracted workers, interns).

7574672E021F445BA58006FDE8EA3CAD.description:
Describe the impact of a business’s strategy, structure and culture on human
resources management.

D301E75CCBFB46BBA0B69492E44DF2A6.description: Explain the role and functions of human resources management.

E99C0F3BB05B404F8FA41C70331A0E42.description: Human Resources Planning: Identify human resources policies, processes and strategies.

4ACB9C32FF2D45518B9DC4B9650E0BB0.description:
Evaluate project results (e.g., compare project results to expectations, conduct
surveys, review lessons learned), and recommend follow-up actions.

5B79637608DD423C8D5220413BEAD1C9.description:
Manage the project team to reduce conflict and meet project objectives (e.g.,
establish group norms, identify and provide training opportunities, facilitate
cross-team communication, catalog and resolve issues, provide feedback).

7FF6811E2BE14E77A20D4F58553B8567.description: Communicate project completion status and potential delays to stakeholders.

D38593D3329D4D8DAE2956EB3638B3E2.description:
Manage project schedule, monitor completion status, identify potential delays and
review costs.

38DDAB23BAF6416A8EA4CAF787A43E80.description:
Monitor changes to project scope and critical path and make adjustments to project
activities.

25CC7CB0819A407E9FD96DA488A837C6.description:
Define project objectives, scope, outputs and resource requirements (i.e., project
charter and statement of work).

4E36BBFF60F845AB8496D786DBEF358E.description: Explain the impact of expectation setting on project outcomes.

3A8F5BA0D739467082E2A4FCC67D9A8F.description:
Compare and contrast the role and responsibilities of project sponsors, project
managers and project team members.

C00EF8F990064436882E4FDA2DE75B69.description: Project Management: Plan, manage and evaluate projects.

D2C1321627A2409AA9F3A97B4E6C6189.description: Measure the success of change efforts.

6F48CA94E2B3468D9EC9AE1A6E395B61.description: Identify key steps in the change management process.

4B6F2435C6964308A737774C30436703.description: Identify factors considered in selecting and executing organizational change.

F171115D87FE46CF827639E7DF98E06B.description: Evaluate opportunities for business or departmental changes.

064A7E02695746F7B2B8512FB6912CE9.description: Select and apply a change management strategy to resolve a business problem.

79B2C5230A04430B801B44AA18613C90.description:
Compare and contrast strategies and approaches for leading changes involving how
things are done versus changes in business values and culture.

E57B537947054F949874A9816A730015.description:
Identify factors that create or contribute to resistance to organizational change and
describe their impact on the speed of change.

AB166F7DF2504ECF94DFACE7BBF00397.description: Change Management: Plan, create and manage change initiatives.

0C989D303E3B41119FD67A5966AEEC9B.description: Describe how cultural differences may impact the business structure and strategies.

1B80699506F34E6BA1BD2BD25A479813.description:
Distinguish key performance indicators across departments (e.g., finance, marketing,
logistics) and select metrics to evaluate the performance of strategies.

F1A83E4B6B5C4BDF835CC97353F8B1D3.description: Describe how to determine the policies required to support strategies and tactics.

74FF218198F4411B9C70F0846FE38605.description: Describe the relationship of strategies and tactics to goals and objectives.

68658CFFCE9A430EB40D83F7EF91C7A7.description:
Identify strategies and tactics required to support the goals and objectives of the
business plan; and adjust departmental plans.

D6A7BC10EED54040A8FCB04ED243A69E.description: Describe the process and structure of business planning.

7841BE1309A04F7A97237FB2D62E8139.description: Evaluate the effectiveness of the strategic-planning process.

37D2D3BFFB1A41E7836E5248097BD659.description: Track achievement of goals and objectives using key performance indicators.

5B3732D3C4B341C4B8FDFFD435AC3FF4.description:
Develop strategic plans (e.g., marketing, research and development, procurement,
production, human resources, information technology).

D5347A46B23C4A6C99905A18C55F31D4.description:
Describe how to develop, quantify and communicate business mission, vision and
goals.

2DD014AB401A40F6B011880FA8A9D277.description:
Identify and benchmark (e.g., dashboards, scorecards) key performance indicators
and key risk indicators.

EAED65F0F0B846928EE76B079D102C43.description:
Conduct an analysis of the business' strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and
threats (i.e., SWOT analysis) to support development of the business plan.

6F28F3F7B9D34B1D9990C371132BC066.description:
Describe strategic planning processes and the relationship between strategic
planning, business plans and departmental plans.

C6CD42B768BB44CEA8CD544D5A1E34F2.description: Strategic Planning: Apply strategic planning processes.

FD51DAF05FCC4619838D4AB7EE253810.description:
Identify the factors that contribute to operational risk (e.g., training, supervision,
security, system design, employment policies).

D1427CB6188A44B19F45684C1FA67ACB.description:
Contrast operational risk with other types of business risk (e.g., market risk, credit
risk, strategic risk).

A981F21CC4A04DD0948CD2D5DC32000D.description: Explain the role and function of organizational development.

D02BF56E17534DD8BCAB807A4D537B1D.description: Explain the role and function of project management.

4F313AB59640432886CB0F03874C9668.description: Explain the role and function of quality management.

DAB5F9297F3B45AAA6DCC92DA8E1E02E.description: Explain the role and function of knowledge management.

E1A8F5393DBB4AE3A46A55C30E6D17D8.description:
Distinguish among data management, information management and knowledge
management; and explain legal and ethical considerations associated with each.

D621F36F99A5489B8093E7816475E1BA.description: Describe how cultural differences impact management practices.

FADA5E98CA3E4FFEBD12BB24DD44D0B7.description:
Explain the role of management functions (e.g., planning, organizing, staffing,
leading, controlling), and how they impact business activities.

F41DBD86401D46A8B18016A9913D8253.description: Explain the differences between managing internal versus external resources.

989DE129F9B645459BA6CF3AF8B5F8FC.description:
Describe decision-making styles (e.g., analytical, abstract or conceptual, intuitive,
creative, procedural or directive), and identify the factors that influence their
effectiveness.

BE4AC4F979B74A858B5B2F7141CDC3E2.description:
Distinguish between management and leadership, and describe the characteristics of
each.

F253D10A9A724A61951F234D369F7536.description: Management Fundamentals: Identify business management functions and strategies.

8297DA5E82DF4EB9A14240988D9AC2C7.description:
Business Management: Learners identify and apply policies, processes and strategies for effective management of
information, projects, strategy and talent.

F7962AF2E64448A5A28A9805C34BB57D.description: Determine situations in which escalation to a governance member is appropriate.

ABB03ADEA1EA448CA972A0A0997768F0.description:
Identify the elements of a corporate governance structure that impact staff
decision-making authority.

7F4F1EB4435B4581A83E608941ECAE6F.description:
Identify the elements of a governance process (e.g., minutes, records, proxies), and
distinguish elements used in public and private businesses.

D40BA5C565974E71A0BCDD0066069FAC.description:
Explain the roles and responsibilities of governing committees (e.g., Board of
Directors, Audit and Finance Committees, Risk Committees), strategies used to fulfill
these responsibilities and the impact on strategic planning and management
functions.

2602BF496A7D4FB2AB679324485D36AA.description:
Describe the relationship between governance structures, ownership structures (e.g.,
corporation, privately owned, nonprofit, limited-liability companies) and organizational
size and reach (e.g., microenterprise, middle-market, large corporate, multinational,
global).

8DEC6CFDD9224E53A8D8C4FE6C2AF987.description:
Explain the role and function of governance structures and their impact on business
objectives.

7F3734990AFD43EA9A1F460986F57C99.description: Governance Structures: Relate business governance structures to business operations, activities and strategies.

5BBFAC3AD8604C679669DD71A95B2463.description:
Differentiate ways in which businesses exhibit corporate social responsibility across
industry sectors.

708D6DA6005E4331B0C8967EB2F0C01D.description: Identify and report noncompliance with corporate social responsibility policies.

2E2E3BBCA4E74544AA3BE9ACFD6988ED.description:
Identify factors that impact the social responsibility policies implemented by
businesses (e.g., national and state and local regulations, market or customer
trends, profit considerations).

C3A57196B0904ED397C6AF6A2ACA21A1.description:
Describe the purpose of corporate social responsibility policies and practices, and
their impact on business activities.

A4A713DF2E7B4DFF841A2FA24A2353E6.description:
Compare and contrast ethical challenges across industry sectors, global markets,
nonprofit and for-profit organizations and business activities.

00BB0029675A4578A704EF069D19CB37.description: Corporate Social Responsibility: Identify and evaluate corporate social responsibility policies and strategies.

721D98BCAA39420B952E8E0BBE466CDC.description:
Describe the rights and responsibilities of the employer and employee in
an employment contract or employment relationship

31F320A75BC54F4AAE91780D38C8E785.description:
Describe the purpose of employment laws and workplace regulations (e.g., OSHA,
ADA, FMLA, NLRA, Title VII, OFCCP, Minor Labor Laws, FLSA and related state
laws).

D1DC6EDF98F5491B81E3AA1299C5C66E.description: Legal Environment: Identify legal processes and requirements that impact business operations.

6675526017F44ED1A22BF9902D6BE4D2.description:
Explain the role and function of compliance assessment activities (e.g., due-diligence
reviews, internal audits, work plan reviews).

A9CC46F9EEB14339A55A66BB084F353F.description:
Analyze existing policies, procedures and documents to ascertain compliance with
regulatory requirements and self-regulatory guidelines.

DB290D4A26764FD0853F6AED79C5D8C4.description:
Develop the elements of a basic compliance program to promote consistent
behaviors (e.g., policies, procedures, training).

2F18EF940FDC44BBB6B5134FC2F94B06.description:
Explain the elements of a compliance program and how requirements and
expectations differ across industry sectors (e.g., financial services, healthcare,
consumer products, restaurants food and beverages).

026EB7B3426E4D11AF866F3BFD830668.description:
Explain the impact of compliance requirements on business structure, activities,
products, services and pricing.

0233B162C5444C989EB3E1CB1ECE32C9.description: Compliance: Identify policies, processes and strategies to manage compliance.

33B9691266A849A1AA26D4295A1CA72E.description: Describe ways businesses prevent, control, transfer and retain risks

E09F2386C90A4BE698E4F4E0448AE925.description:
Describe and compare types of business risks (e.g., strategic, operational, financial,
compliance, reputational).

6B914761083142BA8011557BC1818BD7.description:
Explain the role of enterprise risk management in protecting and creating value for
stakeholders.

F0D08AD8ACB74B2183F61AA8DFA2BFF1.description: Risk Management Fundamentals: Identify policies, processes and strategies to manage risk.

F3326474B62045F9BE57CDCCE3C8D6B8.description:
Business Governance: Learners acquire foundational legal knowledge and apply business governance principles to
minimize risk, maintain organizational compliance and establish and maintain organizational
structure.

45F70009E51848058D2E0948FF9B2C09.description:
Identify strategies to promote diversity, equity and inclusion in business
communications.

4052BC751B194D0398053D0427DFAA2E.description: Describe the purpose of business communications in managing crises.

E07EBC79674B445D8C7EE191B62F0F25.description:
Communicate the business’s plans, strategies and procedures, and verify the
understanding of recipients.

00D1D171FD69471FB7D8DA140C037B36.description: Implement strategies to solicit and provide feedback.

D03CBCA7EDBA4B6B9499A5242BC15768.description: Business Communications Management: Plan, create and evaluate internal and external business communications.

8B82186DE28A473BB9403A7A6C63351D.description: Describe ways that businesses build positive employer-employee relationships.

EF767800C77B46288D66641F36F0C91C.description: Describe how organizational culture impacts business relationships.

AAAE14B7CA524E6791A4A5A0BE4DAC17.description: Adapt to and lead workplace changes or situations.

78E4CFF16F844B11BB67C10F6038BCE7.description:
Explain how alignment between personal and organizational goals contributes to a
successful business.

B78B165D64AF45A592925961AEE09D99.description:
Describe how differing personality types, communication and leadership styles
impact business relationships.

693E141A36BF413997EC3B483BD5C2CC.description: Relationship Management: Manage internal and external business relationships.

39D96265D9A041A29B655C5440A59A3F.description:
Business Communications: Learners communicate with internal and external stakeholders by applying relationship
management techniques and business communication processes and strategies.

35B7D610CCDD4D25B0E063337450A649.description:
Explain how the need to protect assets and reduce the risk of fraud impacts the
design of business processes (e.g., segregation of duties, internal controls)

1F511F780F0047028675FF0E0C705C6B.description:
Describe the role of information technology and the integration of social networking
into business process performance.

E4211EF5DAF24D51B67FC5BA6EFD56C8.description: Describe the differences between policies, processes and procedures.

14FBDC6033F340DA8F75E9F8BDCD1726.description: Explain the role and function of business processes and their interrelationships.

DCCB1CF70BCB48BE9286A04974A02AA0.description: Explain the impact of organizational structure on business processes.

C9A17EAD59F44A7DB7C60FD9EB40D6CF.description: Business Processes: Relate business processes to business models, operations and strategies.

13C99C0A57A548DBA50CEBA714315409.description:
Explain how businesses are adapting to the current environment (i.e., business
agility).

4E4C5EC6A7B347D798588001375CA6ED.description:
Compare the differences in implementation of business activities that occur in big
versus small business.

F947C323BD1A4080A249BE54680AA8D9.description:
Describe connections between business actions and results (e.g., influencing
consumer behavior, gaining market share).

DC36B9617C1645B2821FEDD0BA0773A3.description:
Explain factors that motivate customers, clients and businesses to buy and actions
employees can take to achieve the business’s desired results.

8603E3A2EF5F4600B4981AD1076C893D.description:
Explain the role and function of strategic management and how it interacts with other
business activities.

113F2EAD6B5141E8B36F4F81D94D2166.description:
Explain forces driving business changes (e.g., globalization, consumer demand,
government policies, legal/regulatory changes, political climate, diversity, spending
trends, industry structure changes).

BEF3438BCF5842829789AD63610E3AD9.description: Business Activities: Relate business functions to business models, operations and strategies.

BBBDAA86E80F41009585430F63DAD92A.description:
Business Foundations: Learners acquire foundational knowledge of business activities supported by economic
principles, business processes and global business considerations.

211E2ED2391441CBABEA5A0B7344313A.description:
Identify the strengths, weaknesses and characteristics of leadership styles that
influence internal and external workplace relationships.

46E32469920949F58E7E8DEDDB129022.description:
Use problem-solving and consensus-building techniques to draw conclusions and
determine next steps.

C1EC6C077AD94F969AA29D0A9807C86F.description: Use negotiation and conflict-resolution skills to reach solutions.

BA96E42E1DE34E8796B0AC63A6A6B1CF.description:
Leadership and Communications: Process, maintain, evaluate and disseminate information in a business. Develop leadership
and team building to promote collaboration.

67022E29A33040918CD0D1151F741E34.description:
Develop a career plan that reflects career interests, pathways, and secondary and
postsecondary options.

BF54C78E543B4F6DBC40B08B1D2EDCF3.description:
Identify the scope of career opportunities and the requirements for education,
training, certification, licensure and experience.

D4EE717692D7494784FB8BEB28CBCCBE.description: Identify the knowledge, skills and abilities necessary to succeed in careers.

B52A414BE7084F5E87E0F2BD670F3AEF.description:
Employability Skills: Develop career awareness and employability skills (e.g., face‐to‐face, online) needed for
gaining and maintaining employment in diverse business settings.

EDE6859BE4BD4CCC8159B675A579F9CC.description:
Business Operations/21st Century Skills: Learners apply principles of economics, business management, marketing and employability
in an entrepreneur, manager and employee role to the leadership, planning, developing and
analyzing of business enterprises related to the career field.
